title: A knight templar abroad;
author: Cord, W. Harlan.
snippet: Holyrood Chapel is all that remains of the old Abbey, and of the ancient structure nothing remains 'but the walls, the roof having fallen in many years since, and never having been restored ; but much of the architecture of the remaining portion of the venerable and historic ruin, is said by competent critics to belong to the architecture of a period much later.

title: A Knight Templar abroad; or, Reminiscences of travel beyond the sea
author: Cord, W. Harlan.
snippet: Holyrood Chapel is all that remains of the oldAbbey, and of the ancient structure nothing remainsbut the walls, the roof having fallen in many yearssince, and never having been restored ; but much of thearchitecture of the remaining portion of the venerableand historic ruin, is said by competent critics to belongto the architecture of a period much later.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: We drove in under Arthur's Seat, where the crowdbegan to be very great, and here the Guard ofRoyal Archers met us ; Lord Elcho walking nearme, and the Duke of Roxburgh and Sir J. Hope onAlbert's side. We passed by Holyrood Chapel,which is very old and full of interest, and HolyroodPalace, a royal-looking old place. The processionmoved through the Old Town up the High Street,which is a most extraordinary street from theimmense height of the houses, most of them beingeleven stories high, and different families livingin each story.

title: Ghosts I have seen and other psychic experiences,
author: Tweedale, Violet
snippet: In 1895 Marie, Duchesse de Pomar and Countess of Caithness, died. She had the right to claim burial in Holyrood Chapel, and a very simple stone marks

title: Rambles in Europe.
author: Miller, Daniel
snippet: A large picture gallery contains  many imaginary portraits of the kings of Scotland. On the north of the palace are the ruins of Holyrood Chapel, once a fine building. In this chapel Queen Mary was married to Both well, after her husband.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: While riding from Leith toHolyrood on March 27, 1682, his horse fell with him. His injuries provedfatal, and he died next day, and was buried in Holyrood Chapel.

title: Philadelphians abroad.
author: [Conlen, William James]
snippet: Adjoining the palace was the ruined Holyrood Chapel, with the afternoon sun shining through its casements and making such a picture  that we went outside to the hansom for our camera. In the midst of taking the picture we were apprehended by a guard who threatened  to have us confined in the castle.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: Arbroath and Kilwinning Abbeys, St. Andrew's and ElginCathedrals, and Holyrood Chapel, afforded perfect specimensof purity of design and beauty of execution that had neverbeen surpassed in any other country, even in structures oflarger size. These works had been said sometimes toresemble English, sometimes to resemble French churches.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: He has been most kind toHendrick Andersen, my Norwegian sculptor friend inRome. I also paid my " belle-sceur" Grace and FreddyGower a visit at Versailles, and called on Pomar, theson of Lady Caithness, Duchesse de Pomar, who diedsome years ago, and is buried in Holyrood Chapel. Shewas under the impression that she was Mary Queen ofScots revivified, and the house, or rather palace, whichshe and her son built is full of portraits of Maria Reg.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: While riding from Leith toHolyrood on March 27, 1682, his horse fell with him. His injuries provedfatal, and he died next day, and was buried in Holyrood Chapel.
